items.label: ax:confining-potential-hybrid
items.title: Axiom of a Globally Confining Potential
items.raw_directive:
532: These are the foundational axioms, inherited from the original framework, that guarantee the existence of the underlying stable system which we are perturbing.
533: 
534: :::{prf:axiom} Axiom of a Globally Confining Potential
535: :label: ax:confining-potential-hybrid
536: 
537: The potential `U(x)` used to define the stability force `F_stable = -∇U(x)` must satisfy the **Axiom of a Globally Confining Potential** as stated in `04_convergence.md` (Axiom 1.3.1). It must be smooth, coercive, and compatible with the boundary.

items.label: ax:positive-friction-hybrid
items.title: Axiom of Positive Friction
items.raw_directive:
539: :::
540: 
541: :::{prf:axiom} Axiom of Positive Friction
542: :label: ax:positive-friction-hybrid
543: 
544: The bulk friction coefficient `γ` must be a strictly positive constant: `γ > 0`.

items.label: ax:cloning-env-hybrid
items.title: Foundational Cloning and Environmental Axioms
items.content:
549: :label: ax:cloning-env-hybrid
550: 
551: All foundational axioms related to the cloning operator's pipeline and the environment, as defined in `03_cloning.md` (Chapter 4), must hold. This includes:
552: *   **Axiom EG-2 (Safe Harbor):** Ensures the cloning operator provides boundary safety.
553: *   **Axiom EG-4 (Velocity Regularization):** Ensures the velocity domain is bounded.

items.label: ax:viscous-kernel
items.title: Axiom of a Well-Behaved Viscous Kernel
items.raw_directive:
589: :::
590: 
591: :::{prf:axiom} Axiom of a Well-Behaved Viscous Kernel
592: :label: ax:viscous-kernel
593: 
594: The kernel `K(r)` used in the viscous force `F_viscous` must be a non-negative, bounded, and decaying function of the distance `r = ||x_i - x_j||`. For example, a Gaussian kernel `K(r) = exp(-r² / 2l²)`.
